item.description:
Rescheduled for Feb 7 th!
Due to weather Ickyness we are changing the date!

The basic purpose of lighting is to bring out the "subject."

But lets play and work towards something different in this session with the Seven Hill Camera Club and friends. Personally, I get tired of flatly lighted portraits. So- Let's think about lighting as an interesting process of setting up the lights to impart a little bit of personality - really work to get a bit of character into a portrait of a model.

We can explore how dramatic lighting can be achieved with just a single light source strategically placed to a location. Perhaps where it can create high contrast shadows on the face of a subject. Or Maybe some fun side lighting to force a shadow mysteriously down the middle of the subject. We can play with something I like to call "God" Lighting.

We will have the lovely and energetic Ellen as our model for the evening. I can not guarantee each and everyone will get the op to shoot this evening- but bring your cameras anyway and we'll see what we can make happen!

Looking forward to spending some quality photo time with you all.

Cheers,
Scott and Donna
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be the one talking at the front of the room! =)

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Dramatic Lighting Showcase with the 7 Hills Camera Club
